channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Palestinian convicted in bombing plot is now an award-winning novelist, and free
item.description: Bassem Khandaqji entered prison 21 years ago for plotting a deadly bombing in Israel. He left prison as an award-winning novelist.

item.title: 50 years after the birth of special education, some fear for its future under Trump
item.description: The Trump administration has fired, or tried to fire, many of the federal staff who manage and enforce federal disability law in schools.

item.title: Belgium rejects EU plan to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine
item.description: Belgium on Wednesday rejected a plan to use frozen Russian assets to help prop up Ukraine's economy and war effort over the next two years, saying tha...

item.title: Dems seek to limit who can be immigration judges. And, the GOP wins House election
item.description: Democrats seek to limit who can serve as immigration judges amid layoffs from the administration. And, Republican Matt Van Epps narrowly wins a specia...

item.title: One year on from martial law crisis, South Korea celebrates its democracy's resilience
item.description: One year on from failed presidential power grab, South Korea celebrates its resilient democracy, and tries to heal deep political divisions.

item.title: Steve Rosenberg: Putin showing no signs of compromise
item.description: The BBC's Russia Editor shares his analysis after five hours of peace talks between the Russians and the US.

item.title: Kenyan MPs accuse British soldiers of sexual abuse and environmental destruction
item.description: A two-year investigation details disturbing accounts of rape, sexual violence, murders and environmental destruction.

item.title: Drunk raccoon found passed out on liquor store floor after breaking in
item.description: The intoxicated animal suffered no injuries and was released back into the wild by animal protection once sober.

item.title: Malaysia says hunt for MH370 to resume this month
item.description: 11 years after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 vanished without a trace, a U.S. firm is to resume its hunt for the Boeing 777 in the Indian Ocean.

item.title: Former EU top diplomat Mogherini accused in fraud investigation
item.description: The inquiry centres on allegations of favouritism in EU funding for a training programme at a school headed by Federica Mogherini.

item.title: Man accused of swallowing $19,000 pendant inspired by Bond movie
item.description: The alleged loot was a limited-edition, Fabergé egg pendant inspired by the 1983 James Bond film Octopussy.

item.title: 10/29: CBS Morning News
item.description: Hurricane Melissa moves into Cuba as Jamaica surveys catastrophic damage; Microsoft and OpenAI announce a restructuring deal.

item.title: Where are home prices headed this December? Here's what to consider now.
item.description: With mortgage rates declining, home prices could soon be impacted. Here's what to consider this month.

item.title: India revokes order for phone makers to install security app amid uproar
item.description: India's government, amid an uproar over privacy, has revoked an order quietly issued to smartphone makers to pre-install a state-run security app.

item.title: Trump targets Minnesota’s Somali community with harsh words and policies
Was it a coup or was it a 'sham'? Behind Guinea-Bissau's military takeover
item.description: The military has taken over but some say the overthrow of the president was not what it seemed.

item.title: Federal authorities plan operation in Minnesota focusing on Somali immigrants, AP source says
item.description: Federal authorities are preparing an immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota, focusing on Somali immigrants living unlawfully in the U.S.

item.title: Trump-backed Republican Matt Van Epps wins US House special election in Tennessee
